snippet: The police chief of Durham said a new state law would erode trust among undocumented residents, but officials in other so-called sanctuary cities weren’t sure what practical changes might result.
abstract: Jose Lopez, chief of police in Durham, NC, says new 'sanctuary city' policies will force him to suspend rule that advised his officers not to inquire into immigration status; argues that change will cause undocumented immigrants to avoid police interactions and refuse to cooperate; dilemma reflects challenges nationwide as more cities seek to punish local governments that refuse to cooperate with federal immigration officials.
lead_paragraph: The police chief of Durham said a new state law would erode trust among undocumented residents, but officials in other so-called sanctuary cities weren’t sure what practical changes might result.

headline.main: Immigration Sanctuary Ban Creates Uncertainty in North Carolina
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Turns Sanctuary Into Uncertainty
